      • getAndroidPlatformTarget

        public AndroidPlatformTarget getAndroidPlatformTarget()
                                               throws NoAndroidSdkException
        Returns the AndroidPlatformTarget, if present. If not, throws a NoAndroidSdkException. Use this when your logic requires the user to specify the location of an Android SDK. A user who is building a "pure Java" (i.e., not Android) project using Buck should never have to exercise this code path.

        If the location of an Android SDK is optional, then use getAndroidPlatformTargetOptional().

        Throws:
        NoAndroidSdkException - if no AndroidPlatformTarget is available

      • getAndroidPlatformTargetOptional

        public Optional<AndroidPlatformTarget> getAndroidPlatformTargetOptional()
        Returns an AndroidPlatformTarget if the user specified one via local.properties or some other mechanism. If the user failed to specify one, Optional.absent() will be returned.

      • getTargetDeviceOptional

        public Optional<TargetDevice> getTargetDeviceOptional()
